snippet: Joep Lange, a pioneer from the early years of the AIDS crisis, played a key role in making H.I.V. treatments available in the developing world.
abstract: Downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 claims lives of number of people headed to International AIDS Conference, including Joep Lange, leading AIDS researcher; Lange, who once led the International AIDS Society, was major advocate of affordable drugs for AIDS patients in poor countries.

byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and DONALD G. McNEIL Jr
byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Amsterdam, and Donald G. McNeil Jr. from New York. Catherine Saint Louis and Pam Belluck contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Joep Lange, a pioneer from the early years of the AIDS crisis, played a key role in making H.I.V. treatments available in the developing world.

headline.main: Leading AIDS Researcher, ‘Always Traveling,’ Is Killed on His Way to a Conference
headline.print_headline: Leading AIDS Researcher, ‘Always Traveling,’ Is Killed on His Way to a Conference
